Title: Bust of a Priest Wearing "Persian" Garment
Description: One of a small number of surviving busts, this was probably a model for a larger work.  The garment resembles those worn by officials when Egypt was part of the Persian Empire.  The facial features are remarkable for their naturalistic rendering of old age.
Provenance: Khaouam [Khawam Brothers] Sale, 1931, no. 5, Cairo, [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1931, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Second Floor: Egyptian Art
